intro: Anagallis fruticosa, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or red mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Anagallis fruticosa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
